cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles WSW of the Dry Tortugas and 125 miles N of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift slowly in the southeastern Gulf of Mexico through Tuesday, then turn north and finally northeast, moving across the Florida Gulf Coast late Thursday-Friday and toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast by early Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for portions of western Cuba (La Habana, Artemisa, Mayabeque, Pinar del Río, Isle of Youth).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and Peninsula, Florida Big Bend, and the Georgia–South Carolina coastline late week.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible as Eta’s remnants pass.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Georgia coast; minor water level rises (≤1 ft) possible with onshore winds at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Friday-Saturday, with brief heavier squalls producing localized ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms and brief marine squalls could interrupt vessel movements; elevated rip-current risk along nearby beaches.
